{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3159154,"name":"Clark Hillabrant","username":"Chilly","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/e5b9ba/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-07T14:06:13.090Z","cooked":"

Hey guys, I’m having trouble with some mecanum path planner code. You can find our code in RobotContainer here: GitHub - SHPRobotics/MecanumCartesianGyroTest2---02-09-2023

the problem is likely that our path’s opening and loading fails to run. These are the specific lines that are not running. Note* that our paths / have been changed to \ and the problem still exists.
try{
// get the directory name where the trajectory path is located
Path trajectoryPath = Filesystem.getDeployDirectory().toPath().resolve(filename);
// build the trajectory from PathweaverJson file
trajectory = TrajectoryUtil.fromPathweaverJson(trajectoryPath);
}

Please provide the specific error/stacktrace you receive.

Edit: nevermind. I looked at the code and see the issue. In the future, please provide it when asking.

Your issue is that you’re using an absolute path to the file, specifically using a windows path (C:\....). The code runs on the roborio which runs linux, not windows, and linux doesn’t use paths with drive letters like windows does. This page in the docs is specific to pathweaver, not pathplanner, but it does show how to reference paths correctly.

You need to put the path file in deploy/pathplanner and load it through their built in functions. It is better to just use their functions anyways.

a bit of a half solution, the path now reads bc we changed our quotes to " deploy/pathplanner/generatedJSON/straight.wpilib.json"

However, I now need to figure out why it goes back and forth erratically. probably some values need to be tweaked.

Not that I am aware of, but the workflow kind of goes like this. First create path for the entire auton in pathplanner, including stop points. Next drop the path file into deploy/pathplanner. I am going to assume you are using command based because I can’t look at GitHub on school Wi-Fi. Create a space for the command to be executed, this could be in autos.Java or a separate file. Load the file into an array list or list of pathplannertrajectories. Next create a list of ppmecanumcontrollercommands and pass each trajectory into it, filling out the parameters as required. Then, if you want to run a command while the robot is moving, like pick up a cone, you need to create a hash map of the names of the markers and the commands to run at those markers. Then you can create a followpathwithevents object and pass in the mecanum command into it, the path.getmarkers() method, and the hash map. Then you can pass the controller commands and the follow path with events command into a sequential command group and return that.

Also sorry for the awful formatting I don’t have a desktop right now.
